↳ In-reply-to ¬ª do anyone know anything about wireguard? I have a VPS, which runs nginx. If I then want tjat to host something from my house, do I then set up vps as wiregiard server, connect from my house to it - and then serve the wireguard client? or do it the other way around? I think I have to look into it this weekend. would be a nice way to test out things.

@stigatle@yarn.stigatle.no As @movq@www.uninformativ.de said it doesn‚Äôt matter about who initiates the tunnel, the traffic can flow in either direction. So that‚Äôs fine. But I would initiation the tunnel from your home end so your connection is outbound only and you can maintain basically a complete inbound firewall (block everything inbound, except your tunnel traffic) ‚Äì At some point I‚Äôd love to get off Cloudflare and do this myself üëå
